title: Perma-banned for 3rd party malicious software or custom skin programs
body:
So last night around 11:59 pm, i had just finished a game when i was prompted with a message stating that i was permanently suspended and that the client would close. I instantly panic and check my email, only to find an email that states the following:  

Hello Summoner, 

Your account: kirbyparks was banned due to the use of malicious 3rd party programs or modifications to your League of Legends client. We believe that all players should play on equal footing in an effort to promote competitive sportsmanship. You should be aware that modifying your League of Legends client is against the Terms of Use: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse. We hope you can see that it is unsatisfying to play against other players who are using a tool to gain an advantage over others. 

If you wish to dispute the actions taken against your account, you may contact us via this link: http://support.riotgames.com 

Im not sure what I had gotten banned for as I had only used the following programs:
Wooxy: Custom Skin installer
MKLoL: Replay viewer and Jungle Timers i think. (which i had downloaded and rejected it because I was told you could get banned and it was confusing)
Skin Preview: gave me the ability to download custom skins and riot skins to wear during the game, which only i could see and not other summoners.
MOD Skin: Same thing as Skin preview but it had Spirit Guard Udyr on it which Skin Preview didn't have at the time.
Skin Installer Ultimate: I only used this about 2 times and then stopped using it due to its buggyness and inconsistency.

If i log into my account right now, it says this:

This account has been permanently suspended. Please check the email address associated with your League of Legends account for additional details. 

A couple thing to mention was that Trick2g, a famous Udyr player, released several in-depth guides for Udyr. I watched them and spammed Udyr till I went on about a 7 win streak. At the time while i was obsessed with Udyr, i wanted a Spirit Guard Udyr skin badly. So I managed to download Mod Skin, Skin Preview, and MKLOL to find a skin i could use (The end product of the skin ended up being some rip off with missing particles). In the process I got a .rar file of Spirit Guard Udyr and downloaded it through Skin Installer Ultimate. For some reason, while Skin Installer Ultimate didnt run, the default skin for Udyr was changed to the same missing particle Udyr skin. Im not sure if this couldve affected something with the game files, causing me to get banned. 

I would like to know what caused my ban ( if it was one of the programs or the changing of udyrs default skin ), and if my ban could be uplifted once i removed the programs above and repaired my files to fix the Udyr default skin bug.
Thank you,
Kirbyparks

Links:
http://mobaskins.com/?p=2297                                   (Skin Preview)
http://s.modskinlolna.com/Lib/?name=download      (MOD skin)

P.S beware of the Mod Skin link, it has very loud music in the website and you can mute tab before it starts.

Using game mods, addons, and other third party programs is ALWAYS A RISK and you use them AT YOUR OWN RISK. Especially ones that modify game files.

You were probably banned for trying to use a custom skin of an actual Riot skin. While they are generally lenient towards custom skin that are fan made and do not actually copy official skins, the fact that you were trying to copy a Riot skin is probably what got you banned. This is not allowed as people would just then use these programs to play as whatever skin they like, even if it only shows it to them alone and not anyone else in the match due to it cutting into their profits from actual skin/riot point sales.

and if anyone tries to argue about "omg riot so greedy they make so much money already" well yeah they make money from skins that have LITTLE TO NO IMPACT ON ACTUAL GAMEPLAY and are not needed at all to play the game. they make money from selling these cosmetic skins because people want them, not because they're a charity.

It's not really them but their automated systems that detected an alteration, and that alteration no matter what it was is still seen as an alteration to the client in some way even though it doesn't change gameplay, all the bot knew is that the client was changed by a 3rd party. that's why it's a use at your own risk type of thing.
